description: From Hindi बिल्व (bilv) or Marathi बेल (bel), from Sanskrit बिल्व (bilva), विल्व (vilva), or बैल्व (bailva).

entries.meaning: A tropical fruit tree from India, Aegle marmelos.
examples: In the courtyard there were fruit and flowering trees appropriate for the worship of Mahadev, as also a bel tree.

entries.meaning: The fruit of the tree, also called the wood apple.
